conversations.body_text: Tried to have the item repaired, still remains failed.  Switch module on the Right Side (Up Shift) is failed, not sure if the cable inside the device is detached as well. No response from the switch.  Please send New Tested Replacement device with return label for the faulty product sent.

Hi Miguel Collado,  If possible, please provide photos or a video of the issue and share them via Google Drive, making sure to set the appropriate access permissions. Shift issues are usually caused by a slight displacement of the microswitch under the paddle, preventing it from being triggered. You can try pressing the button’s spring manually—if it works, then simply adjusting the preload screws should resolve the problem.

The main problem was the thin cable, disconnected from the switch contact
pins.
I took the Button Box to a local Tech and he soldered the cable to the
switch, switch still does not actuate / work.
I will try adjusting the microswitch as you suggested, I can hear it
actuate/click, but will give this fix a try.

Thanks-

On Sat, Nov 1, 2025 at 9:59 PM service@simsonn.com

The main problem was the thin cable, disconnected from the switch contact pins.  I took the Button Box to a local Tech and he soldered the cable to the switch, switch still does not actuate / work.  I will try adjusting the microswitch as you suggested, I can hear it actuate/click, but will give this fix a try.     Thanks-

Hi Miguel Collado,  Could you take a photo of the soldering area? Since there are three pins, two wires might be connected to the wrong positions. If I check and confirm that the issue is caused by soldering, I can help fix it and also provide you with some USD compensation.

We re-soldered according to how it arrived.  New cable and solder shown. I
should have taken a picture of the condition after package arrival.
The shift lever also feels "sticky", during push and release of the paddle.

Many Thanks and Kind Regards-
